verses.verse: How beautiful<WH3302> are your feet<WH6471> with shoes<WH5275>, O prince<WH5081>'s daughter<WH1323>! the joints<WH2542> of your thighs<WH3409> are like jewels<WH2481>, the work<WH4639> of the hands<WH3027> of a skillful workman<WH542>.
Your navel<WH8326> is like a round<WH5469> goblet<WH101>, which wants<WH2637> not liquor<WH4197>: your belly<WH990> is like a heap<WH6194> of wheat<WH2406> set about<WH5473> with lilies<WH7799>.
Your two<WH8147> breasts<WH7699> are like two<WH8147> young<WH6082> roes<WH6646> that are twins<WH8380>.

Your neck<WH6677> is as a tower<WH4026> of ivory<WH8127>; your eyes<WH5869> like the fishpools<WH1295> in Heshbon<WH2809>, by the gate<WH8179> of Bath<WH1337>â€“rabbim: your nose<WH639> is as the tower<WH4026> of Lebanon<WH3844> which looks<WH6822> toward<WH6440> Damascus<WH1834>.
Your head<WH7218> upon you is like Carmel<WH3760>, and the hair<WH1803> of your head<WH7218> like purple<WH713>; the king<WH4428> is held<WH631> in the galleries<WH7298>.
How fair<WH3302> and how pleasant<WH5276> are you<WH160>, O love, for delights<WH8588>!
This your stature<WH6967> is like<WH1819> to a palm tree<WH8558>, and your breasts<WH7699> to clusters of grapes<WH811>.

I said<WH559>, I will go up<WH5927> to the palm tree<WH8558>, I will take hold<WH270> of the boughs<WH5577> there<WH7699>: now also your breasts shall be as clusters<WH811> of the vine<WH1612>, and the smell<WH7381> of your nose<WH639> like apples<WH8598>;

And the roof of your mouth<WH2441> like the best<WH2896> wine<WH3196> for my beloved<WH1730>, that goes<WH1980> down sweetly<WH4339>, causing the lips<WH8193> of those that are asleep<WH3463> to speak<WH1680>.
I am my beloved<WH1730>'s, and his desire is toward me<WH8669>.
Come<WH3212>, my beloved<WH1730>, let us go forth<WH3318> into the field<WH7704>; let us lodge<WH3885> in the villages<WH3723>.

Let us get up early<WH7925> to the vineyards<WH3754>; let us see<WH7200> if the vine<WH1612> flourish<WH6524>, whether the tender grape<WH5563> appear<WH6605>, and the pomegranates<WH7416> bud forth<WH5132>: there will I give<WH5414> you my loves<WH1730>.

The mandrakes<WH1736> give<WH5414> a smell<WH7381>, and at our gates<WH6607> are all manner of pleasant<WH4022> fruits<WH2319>, new and old<WH3465>, which I have laid up<WH6845> for you<WH1730>, O my beloved.
